meanings.definition: A bird of the woodpecker family with a twisted neck.
meanings.sent1: The wryneck perched on the branch, its neck twisted in a peculiar way.
meanings.sent2: I spotted a wryneck in the forest, its neck looking twisted like a corkscrew.
meanings.sent3: The wryneck's twisted neck made it the comedian of the bird family.
meanings.sent4: Her hair was like a wryneck's neck, spiraling in an unusual manner.
meanings.sent5: The wryneck's neck was so twisted, it resembled a pretzel.

meanings.definition: A condition in which the neck is twisted to one side.
meanings.sent1: After the accident, he suffered from wryneck, causing his neck to be stuck in an awkward position.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed her with wryneck, recommending gentle exercises to relieve the strain.
meanings.sent3: Despite his wryneck, he managed to laugh it off and make light of the situation.
meanings.sent4: Her wryneck was a physical representation of the twist in her life's journey.
meanings.sent5: The wryneck made it hard for him to turn his head, like a stubborn door with a rusty hinge.
